name: Daniel Dennett
background: Daniel Clement Dennett III (1942–2024) was an American philosopher, cognitive scientist, and author. Co-director of Tufts University's Center for Cognitive Studies and Austin B. Fletcher Professor of Philosophy. Renowned for philosophy of mind, consciousness, intentional stance, free will compatibilism, evolutionary explanation of culture/mind. Key works: Consciousness Explained (1991), Darwin's Dangerous Idea (1995), Breaking the Spell (2006), Intuition Pumps and Other Tools for Thinking (2013). 'Four Horsemen' of New Atheism.

principles.name: Compatibilist Free Will
principles.description: Free will = evolved capacity for rational deliberation, evitability (could have done otherwise via better reasons), avoidance of coercion; compatible with determinism.
principles.falsification: When compatibilist free will leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Darwin's Dangerous Idea
principles.description: Natural selection as 'universal acid' explaining design (mind, morality, meaning) without designer; greedy reductionism via bottom-up processes.
principles.falsification: When darwin's dangerous idea leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Heterophenomenology
principles.description: Neutral scientific method: describe subjects' beliefs/phenomenology as data ('intentional inexistents'), bracket existence questions.
principles.falsification: When heterophenomenology leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Intentional Stance
principles.description: Strategy of interpreting/predicting behavior by attributing beliefs, desires, rationality to systems (humans, animals, AIs, thermostats) at abstraction level yielding best predictions.
principles.falsification: When intentional stance leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
